basics.name: Steven Enten
basics.label: Software engineer
basics.summary: I'm a software engineer specialized in distributed systems. I'm passionate about the Web since the 56K dial-up Internet to the decentralized application era. I enjoy to design and experiment new ways to develop the Web of tomorrow through decentralized or universal web application.

work.summary: Le Crédit Lyonnais (LCL) is the reference bank in large french cities. LCL distributes its own insurance and banking services and those of the entire group Crédit Agricole. I work in the “Banque par Internet” service which manages digital customer endpoints. I'm in charge of rewrite the new universal web platform which merges most current endpoints into a micro frontend services architecture.
highlights: Lead design and development of an universal Angular 5 web platform PoC
Working with IBM to enhance security layer of customer endpoints

work.summary: B3TSI is a market research consulting company. Surveys are managed in a homemade mainframe system. I design, develop and deploy micro frontend services interfaced with the surveys system. The main purpose is to bring new features which cover internal and external communication needs.
highlights: Create web platforms to collect survey responses from the web
Redesign and migrate data systems to bring an anonymization layer

work.summary: AutoVisual by L'argus is an auto offers aggregator and price comparator. Several bots daily crawl new offers to score and index them. I manage the split of the procedural proof-of-concept system into reusable functional packages to be deployed in a containers environment. The main purpose is to remove deadlocks due to the initial procedural and monolithic approach.
highlights: Design a distributed crawling system to feed a public offers registry
Implement a meta-crawling layer to feed an internalized vehicles registry

work.summary: I conduct training sessions to teach technology courses from company trainees.
highlights: Android: develop mobile apps
Java 8: discover new features by practice
Javascript: develop web applications full Javascript

location.address: La grande Arche, Paroi Nord, La Défense, 1 Parvis de la defense

work.summary: Research and development in software mobility through the thesis subject “Communication in embedded systems with mobile agents”. The main purpose is to write a formal specification which describes a fault tolerant communication in a containers environment.
highlights: Revision of the cloudlet architecture with software containers
Run software containers on Android 5 ARM64

location.address: 3 rue de la Porte de Buc

work.summary: Essilor is a leader in corrective lens manufacturing. Tens of thousands lense orders are registered each day. Within the operations department, I manage and develop a reporting system which handled orders of the France area. The reporting system provides indicators to assist decisions taken by services inside the operations department.
highlights: Ensure reporting system integrity and availability
Develop reporting models to answer operational needs

work.summary: Provide courses and support to help students with their end-of-year information system projects and exams.
highlights: Teach “Management information systems” course
Organize end-of-year projects development

work.summary: Spill.net is a web agency expert in website development of luxurious brands. I support and develop e-commerce websites based on a homemade framework.
highlights: Frontend development in HTML4, CSS2 and Javascript ES3
Backend development in PHP4 and PERL5
Make Embark by Status work with Angular CLI
Build webpack configs dynamically with Angular Webpack Build Facade

volunteer.summary: Contribute to the Angular CLI Version 6 development by spotting and fixing two issues.
highlights: Issue angular/devkit #698 ServerBuilder can't resolve lazy modules
Issue angular/devkit #700 DevServerBuilder: HMR not work

volunteer.summary: An universal Angular 7 starter kit based on the Angular CLI featuring Server-Side Rendering and Hot Module Reloading on both browser/server sides. It uses the Universal Development Kit through Schematics to perform build and development tasks.
highlights: Universal build task to compile for browser and server at once
Angular dev container to bring an extreme live development experience

volunteer.summary: Universal Development Kit (udk) is a Webpack extension which improves universal Web application development. The main feature is the strict sequential multi-compilation according to the dependencies between bundles.
highlights: Build mode: avoid bundle compilation if a dependency compilation failed
Watch mode: recompile bundles in dependency relations order
Dev container to avoid writing code for development purposes only

volunteer.summary: A starter kit for universal React 15 applications. Written in 2016, it's a first attempt to elaborate an universal toolchain for universal React application development.
highlights: Universal React Web Application
Extreme Hot Module Reloading with React 15 and Webpack 3

volunteer.summary: Manage setup of an ArchLinux rootfs which enables LXC usage on Android: it capitalizes operations needed to achieve that on a virtual Android 5 with custom Goldfish 3.10 kernel.
highlights: Run LXC container identified by its own IP address on the network
Mount cgroups required to support LXC containers

education.area: Mathématiques et Sciences et Technologies de l'Information et de la Communication
Méthodes informatiques appliquées à la gestion des entreprises
Sciences et technologies de la gestion

awards.title: Special thanks to everyone who participated in Angular CLI 6

publications.name: Mobile Application Validation through Virtualization
publications.summary: When several business applications use low level libraries which are not installed in the firmware of the device; a solution consists in building of a new firmware with the well-chosen libraries. After customizing a firmware, we focus on adding business software in place to monitor the embedded device. Thru, we use this firmware to virtualize an embedded device. Thus, we collect information to determine whether the firmware can be deployed on devices. The collected data are about memory usages, threads, and resource access and energy consumption. So, this reporting step sums up the validation of our firmware, then they are validated to a deployment step on mobile devices. Reports are delivered about the behaviors of embedded software.

publications.name: LXC et Android 5 ARM64
publications.summary: How to run LXC containers on a virtual Android 5 ARM64 with custom Goldfish 3.10 kernel run with QEMU Ranchu. The article summarizes every deadlocks encountered to achieve container execution and how we solved them.
